clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Resected Gastric Volume on Postoperative Weight Loss After Laparoscopic Sleeve Gastrectomy for Morbid Obesity

brief_summary.textblock: Impact of resected gastric volume on postoperative weight loss after laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy for morbid obesity. Observational study with a mathematical method to approximate the calculation of the resected gastric volume after a sleeve gastrectomy and see the outcome on weight loss.

primary_outcome.measure: resected gastric volume in laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy
primary_outcome.description: Impact of resected gastric volume on postoperative weight loss after laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy for morbid obesity

intervention.intervention_name: Gastric volume resected in sleeve gastrectomy
intervention.description: Misure of resected gastric volume and outcome

study_pop.textblock: final group from which data have been considered 92 patients (47females and 45 males)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI over 60 kg/m2 in high-risk patients,
- BMI between 50 and 60 kg/m2 in nondiabetic patients,
- BMI between 40 and 50 kg/m2 in patients refusing a complex procedure like Roux-en-Y gastric bypass,
- patients with severe gastric inflammatory disease and H. pylori infection,
- patients with previous abdominal surgery involving the intestines, and young patients refusing gastric banding
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe and documented gastroesophageal reflux disease
- previous gastric surgery.
